ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: In the past two weeks, have you felt sad or depressed? Felt down or empty? Felt grouchy or annoyed?
In the past two weeks, have you been bored a lot or much less interested in things (like playing your favorite games)? Have you felt you could not enjoy things?
In the past two weeks, have you felt that you could not enjoy things?
Is A1 or A2 coded yes?
Have you felt this way most of the day?
Have you felt this way almost everyday?
In the past two weeks, when you felt depressed/grouchy/uninterested: Were you less hungry or more hungry most days? Did you lose or gain weight without trying?

In the past two weeks, when you felt depressed/grouchy/uninterested: Did you have trouble sleeping almost every night ('trouble sleeping' means trouble falling asleep, waking up in the middle of the night, waking up too early or sleeping too much)?
In the past two weeks, when you felt depressed/grouchy/uninterested: Did you talk or move slower than usual? Were you fidgety, restless or couldn't sit still?
In the past two weeks, when you felt depressed/grouchy/uninterested: Did you feel tired most of the time?
In the past two weeks, when you felt depressed/grouchy/uninterested: Did you feel bad about yourself most of the time? Did you feel guilty most of the time?
In the past two weeks, when you felt depressed/grouchy/uninterested: Did you have trouble paying attention? Did you have trouble making up your mind?

In the past two weeks, when you felt depressed/grouchy/uninterested: Did you feel so bad that you wished that you were dead? Did you think about hurting yourself? Did you think about killing yourself?
Have you ever been really frightened or nervous for no reason; or have you ever been really frightened or nervous in a situation where most kids would not feel that way?
If yes, did this happen more than one time?
If yes, did this nervous feeling increase quickly over the first few minutes?
Has this ever happened when you didn't expect it?
After this happened, were you afraid it would happen again? Did you worry for a month or more that it would happen again?
Think about a time you were the most frightened or nervous for no good reason: Did your heart beat fast or loud?
Think about a time you were the most frightened or nervous for no good reason: Did you sweat? Did your hands sweat a lot?
Think about a time you were the most frightened or nervous for no good reason: Did your hands or body shake?
Think about a time you were the most frightened or nervous for no good reason: Did you have trouble breathing?
Think about a time you were the most frightened or nervous for no good reason: Did you feel like you were choking? Did you feel you couldn't swallow?
Think about a time you were the most frightened or nervous for no good reason: Did you have pain or pressure in your chest?
Think about a time you were the most frightened or nervous for no good reason: Did you feel like throwing up? Did you have an upset stomach? Did you have diarrhea?
Think about a time you were the most frightened or nervous for no good reason: Did you feel dizzy or faint?

Think about a time you were the most frightened or nervous for no good reason: Did things around you feel strange or like they weren't real? Did you feel or see things as it they were far away? Did you feel outside of or cut off from your body?
Think about a time you were the most frightened or nervous for no good reason: Were you afraid that you were losing control of yourself? Were you afraid that you were going crazy?
Think about a time you were the most frightened or nervous for no good reason: Were you afraid that you were dying?
Think about a time you were the most frightened or nervous for no good reason: Did parts of your body tingle or go numb?
Think about a time you were the most frightened or nervous for no good reason: Did you feel hot or cold?
DO BOTH E3 AND E4 HAVE 4 OR MORE ANSWERS, CODED YES?
IF E5=NO, ARE 1, 2 OR 3 SYMPTOMS IN E4a-m CODED YES?
In the past month, did you have these problems more than one time? If this happened, did you worry for a month or more that it would happen again?

In the past month, have you been really afraid about being away from someone close to you; or have you been really afraid that you would lose somebody you are close to? (Like getting lost from your parents or having something bad happen to them)
Who are you afraid of losing or being away from?
Did you get upset a lot when you were away from ___? Did you get upset a lot when you thought you would be away from___?
Did you get really worried that you would lose___? Did you get really worried that something bad would happen to ___?
Did you get really worried that you would be separated from ___?
Did you refuse to go to school or other places because you were afraid to be away from ___?
Did you get really afraid being at home if ___ wasn't there?
Did you not want to go to sleep unless ___ was there?
Did you have nightmares about being away from ___? Did this happen more than once?

Did you feel sick a lot (like headaches, stomachaches, nausea or vomiting, heart beating fast or feeling dizzy) when you were away from ___? Did you feel sick a lot when you thought you were going to be away from ___?
ARE AT LEAST 3 OF G2a-h CODED YES?
Has this persisted for at least 4 weeks?
Did your fears of being away from ___ really bother you a lot? Cause you a lot of problems at home? At school? With friends? In any other way?
ARE G1, G2 SUMMARY, G3 AND G4 CODED YES?

For the past six months, have you worried a lot or been nervous? Have you been worried or nervous about several things, (like school, your health, or something bad happening)? Have you been more worried than other kids your age?
Do you worry most days?
IS THE PATIENT'S ANXIETY RESTRICTED EXCLUSIVELY TO, OR BETTER EXPLAINED BY, ANY DISORDER PRIOR TO THIS POINT?
Do you find it hard to stop worrying? Do the worries make it hard for you to pay attention to what you are doing?
When you are worried, do you, most of the time: Feel like you can't sit still?
When you are worried, do you, most of the time: Feel tense in your muscles?
When you are worried, do you, most of the time: Feel tired, weak, or exhausted easily?
When you are worried, do you, most of the time: Have a hard time paying attention to what you are doing? Does your mind go blank?
When you are worried, do you, most of the time: Feel grouchy or annoyed?

When you are worried, do you, most of the time: Have trouble sleeping ('trouble sleeping' means trouble falling asleep, waking up in the middle of the night, wakening up too early or sleeping too much)?
ARE 1 OR MORE U3 ANSWERS CODED YES?
Do these worries or anxieties cause a lot of problems at school or with your friends or at home or at work or with other people?

Has anything really awful ever happened to you? Like being in a flood, tornado, or earthquake? Like being in a fire or a really bad accident? Like seeing someone being killed or badly hurt. Have you ever been attacked by someone?
In the past month, has this awful thing come back to you in some way? Like dreaming about it or having a strong memory of it or feeling it in your body?
In the past month: Have you tried not to think about or talk about this awful thing?
In the past month: Have you tried to stay away from people or things that might remind you of it?
ARE 1 OR MORE J3 ANSWERS CODED YES?
In the past month: Have you had trouble remembering some important part of what happened?
In the past month: Were you down on yourself or others too much?
In the past month: Did you frequently blame yourself or others for the bad things that happened?
In the past month: Did you feel more down on yourself, like feeling guilty, ashamed, angry or frightened?
In the past month: Have you been much less interested in your hobbies or your friends?
In the past month: Have you felt cut off from other people?
In the past month: Have you not been able to feel any good feelings, (like being happy)?
ARE 3 OR MORE J4 ANSWERS CODED YES?
In the past month: Were you been moody or angry for no reason?
In the past month: Did you do more risky things or do things that could harm you?
In the past month: Were you nervous or watching out in case something bad might happen?

In the past month: Would you jump when you heard noises? Or when you saw something
out of the corner of your eye?
In the past month: Did you have trouble paying attention?
In the past month: Did you have trouble sleeping?
ARE 2 OR MORE J5 ANSWERS CODED YES?
Did all these problems start after the traumatic event and last for more than one month?

In the past month, have these problems upset you a lot? Have they caused
you to have problems at school? At home? At work? With your friends?
With your family? Or in some other important way?
IS 'RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)' CODED YES?
SPECIFY IF THE CONDITION IS ASSOCIATED WITH DEPERSONALIZATION, DEREALIZATION OR WITH DELAYED EXPRESSION.
Has anyone (teacher, babysitter, friend, parent) complained about your behavior?
In the past year: Have you bullied or threatened other people?
In the past year: Have you started fights?
In the past year: Have you used a weapon to hurt someone? Like a knife, gun, bat, or other object?
In the past year: Have you hurt someone (physically) on purpose?
In the past year: Have you hurt animals on purpose?
In the past year: Have you stolen things using force? Like robbing someone using a weapon or grabbing something from someone like purse snatching?
In the past year: Have you forced anyone to have sex with you?
In the past year: Have you started fires on purpose in order to cause damage?
In the past year: Have you destroyed things that belonged to other people on purpose?
In the past year: Have you broken into someone's house or car?
In the past year: Have you lied many times in order to get things from people or to get out of things? Tricked other people into doing what you wanted?
In the past year: Have you stolen things that were worth money (Like shoplifting or forging a check)?
In the past year: Have you often stayed out a lot later than your parents let you? Did this start before you were 13 years old?
In the past year: Have you run away from home two times or more?
In the past year: Have you skipped school often? Did this start before you were 13 years old?
ARE AT LEAST 3 ITEMS IN P2a-o ABOVE CODED YES WITH AT LEAST ONE PRESENT IN THE PAST 6 MONTHS?
Did these behaviors cause big problems at school? At home? With your family? Or with your friends?
Has anyone (teacher, baby sitter, friend or parent) ever complained about your behavior or performance in school?
In the past six months: Have you often not paid enough attention to details? Made careless mistakes in school?

In the past six months: Have you often had trouble keeping your attention focused when playing
or doing schoolwork?
In the past six months: Have you often been told that you do not listen when others talk directly to you?

In the past six months: Have you often had trouble following through with what you were
told to do (Like not following through on schoolwork or chores)?
Did this happen even though you understood what you were supposed to do?
Did this happen even though you weren't trying to be difficult? IF NO TO ANY, CODE NO.
In the past six months: Have you often had a hard time getting organized?

In the past six months: Have you often tried to avoid things that make you concentrate
or think hard (like schoolwork)? Do you hate or dislike things
that make you concentrate or think hard? IF YES TO EITHER, CODE YES.

In the past six months: Have you often lost or forgotten things you needed? Like homework
assignments, pencils, or toys?

In the past six months: Do you often get distracted easily by little things (Like sounds or
things outside the room)?

In the past six months: Do you often forget to do things you need to do every day (like forget to comb
your hair or brush your teeth, keeping appointments, doing chores)?
N2 SUMMARY: ARE 6 OR MORE N2 ANSWERS CODED YES?
In the past six months: Did you often fidget with your hands or feet? Or did you squirm in your seat? IF YES TO EITHER, CODE YES.
In the past six months: Did you often get out of your seat in class when you were not supposed to?

In the past six months: Have you often run around or climbed on things when you weren't supposed to?
Did you want to run around or climb on things even though you didn't?
IF YES TO EITHER, CODE YES.
In the past six months: Have you often had a hard time playing quietly?
In the past six months: Were you always 'on the go'?
In the past six months: Have you often talked too much?
In the past six months: Have you often blurted out answers before the person or teacher has finished the question?
In the past six months: Have you often had trouble waiting your turn? Have you often interrupted other people? Like butting in when other people are talking or busy or when they are on the phone?
N3 SUMMARY: ARE 6 OR MORE N3 ANSWERS CODED YES?
Did you have problems paying attention, being hyper, or impulsive before you were 12 years old?
Did these things cause problems at school? At home? With your family? With your friends?
IS N2 SUMMARY AND N3 SUMMARY CODED YES?  AND THE ADHD IS NOT RESTRICTED EXCLUSIVELY TO OR BETTER EXPLAINED BY ANOTHER PSYCHIATRIC DISORDER?
IS N2 SUMMARY CODED YES AND N3 SUMMARY CODED NO?  AND THE ADHD IS NOT RESTRICTED EXCLUSIVELY TO OR BETTER EXPLAINED BY ANOTHER PSYCHIATRIC DISORDER?
IS N2 SUMMARY CODED NO AND N3 SUMMARY CODED YES?  AND THE ADHD IS NOT RESTRICTED EXCLUSIVELY TO OR BETTER EXPLAINED BY ANOTHER PSYCHIATRIC DISORDER?
Has anyone (teacher, baby sitter, friend, parent) ever complained about your behavior or performance in school?
At least once a week, over the past six months: Have you often lost your temper?
At least once a week, over the past six months: Have you often been 'touchy' or easily annoyed by other people?
At least once a week, over the past six months: Have you often been angry and resentful toward others?
At least once a week, over the past six months: Have you often argued with adults?
At least once a week, over the past six months: Have you often refused to do what adults tell you to do? Refused to follow rules?
At least once a week, over the past six months: Have you often annoyed people on purpose?

At least once a week, over the past six months: Have you often blamed other people for your mistakes or for your
bad behavior?

At least once a week, over the past six months: Have you often been "spiteful" or quick to "pay back" somebody who
treats you wrong? Have you done this 2 or more times in the past 6 months? IF YES TO BOTH QUESTIONS, CODE YES.
P2 SUMMARY: ARE 4 OR MORE OF P2 ANSWERS CODED YES?
Did these behaviors last at least 6 months?
Did these behaviors occur with people outside your brothers or sisters?

Did these behaviors cause problems at school? At home? With your family?
Or with your friends?

ARE P2 SUMMARY, P3, P4, P5 CODED YES?
The disorder(s) that met diagnostic criteria during the MINI-KID clinical interview

Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes (If yes to either, code yes)

ElementDescription: Does being near or around (NAME SPECIFIC PHOBIA) make him/her afraid immediately?

Is (s)he so afraid of (NAME SPECIFIC PHOBIA) that (s)he tries to stay away from NO YES it / them? Or (s)he can only be around it / them if someone is with him/her? Or can (s)he be around it / them but it is really hard for him/her?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes (If yes to any, code yes)

ElementDescription: Is (s)he more afraid of (NAME SPECIFIC PHOBIA) than other kids his/her age?
Has (s)he been afraid of (NAME SPECIFIC PHOBIA) for 6 months or more?
Does this fear really bother him/her a lot? Does it cause him/her problems at home or at school or at work or with his/her friends? Does it keep him/her from doing things (s)he wants to do?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes (If yes to any, code yes)

ElementDescription: IS H7 CODED YES?

In the past month, has (s)he been bothered by bad things that come into his/her mind that (s)he could not get rid of? Like bad thoughts or urges? Or nasty pictures? For example, did (s)he think about hurting somebody even though it disturbs or distresses him/her? Was (s)he afraid (s)he or someone would get hurt because of some little thing (s)he did or did not do? Did (s)he worry a lot about having dirt or germs on him/her? Did (s)he worry a lot that (s)he would give someone else germs or make them sick somehow? Or was (s)he afraid that (s)he would do something really shocking?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes (If yes to any, code yes)

ElementDescription: Please specify bad things that come into his/her mind that (s)he could not get rid of

In the past month, did (s)he try to make these thoughts, impulses, or images go away or try to push them away with some other thought or action? SKIP TO I3a DO NOT INCLUDE SIMPLY EXCESSIVE WORRIES ABOUT REAL LIFE PROBLEMS. DO NOT INCLUDE OBSESSIONS DIRECTLY RELATED TO HOARDING, HAIR PULLING, SKIN PICKING, BODY DYSMORPHIC DISORDER, TO EATING DISORDERS, SEXUAL BEHAVIOR, PATHOLOGICAL GAMBLING, OR ALCOHOL OR DRUG ABUSE BECAUSE THE PATIENT MAY DERIVE PLEASURE FROM THE ACTIVITY AND MAY WANT TO RESIST IT ONLY BECAUSE OF ITS NEGATIVE CONSEQUENCES.
Did they keep coming back into his/her mind even when (s)he tried to ignore or get rid of them?

In a period of 2 weeks [during most symptomatic episode], when (s)he felt depressed / grouchy / uninterested: Did (s)he have trouble sleeping almost every night (''trouble sleeping'' means trouble falling asleep, waking up in the middle of the night, waking up too early or sleeping too much)?

In the past month, did (s)he do something over and over without being able to stop doing it, like washing over and over? Straightening things up over and over? Counting something or checking on something over and over? Saying or doing something over and over? SKIP TO I4
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes (If yes to any, code yes)

ElementDescription: Which ones? Something done over and over without being able to stop doing it

Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes (CODE YES ONLY IF YES TO BOTH PARTS OF I3b)

ElementDescription: IDENTIFIED STRESSOR:
DATE OF ONSET OF STRESSOR

Notes: 0= No (If no to either, code no); 1= Yes

ElementDescription: In a period of 2 weeks [during most symptomatic episode], when (s)he felt depressed / grouchy / uninterested: Did (s)he have trouble concentrating or thinking or did (s)he have trouble making up his/her mind almost every day?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes (If yes to either, code yes)

ElementDescription: Is (s)he more upset by this stress than other kids his/her age would be?
Do these stresses or upsets cause him/her problems in school? Problems with his/her family or with his/her friends? Problems in some other important way?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes (IF YES TO V3a OR TO ANY PART OF V3b, CODE YES)

ElementDescription: BEREAVEMENT IS PRESENT IF THESE EMOTIONAL/BEHAVIORAL SYMPTOMS ARE DUE ENTIRELY TO THE LOSS OF A LOVED ONE AND ARE SIMILAR IN SEVERITY, LEVEL OF IMPAIRMENT AND DURATION TO WHAT MOST OTHERS WOULD SUFFER UNDER SIMILAR CIRCUMSTANCES. HAS BEREAVEMENT BEEN RULED OUT?
Have these problems gone on for 6 months or more after the stress stopped?
WHICH OF THESE EMOTIONAL / BEHAVIORAL SUBTYPES ARE PRESENT? Depression, tearfulness or hopelessness.
WHICH OF THESE EMOTIONAL / BEHAVIORAL SUBTYPES ARE PRESENT? Anxiety, nervousness, jitteriness, worry.
WHICH OF THESE EMOTIONAL / BEHAVIORAL SUBTYPES ARE PRESENT? Misbehavior (Like fighting, driving recklessly, skipping school, vandalism, violating other''s rights, doing illegal things).
WHICH OF THESE EMOTIONAL / BEHAVIORAL SUBTYPES ARE PRESENT? School problems, physical complaints or social withdrawal.
IF V1 AND V2 AND (V3a or V3b) ARE CODED YES AND V5 IS CODED NO, THEN CODE THE DISORDER YES WITH SUBTYPES. IF NO, CODE NO TO ADJUSTMENT DISORDER.
ADJUSTMENT DISORDER with:

In a period of 2 weeks [during most symptomatic episode], when (s)he felt depressed / grouchy / uninterested: Did (s)he feel so bad that (s)he wished that (s)he were dead? Did (s)he think about hurting him/herself? Did (s)he have thoughts of death? Did (s)he think about killing him/herself? (FEAR OF DYING DOES NOT COUNT HERE).
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes (If yes to any, code yes)

Just before these symptoms began: Did (s)he have any medical illness?
IF W1a OR W1b IS CODED YES, IN THE CLINICIAN''S JUDGMENT, IS EITHER LIKELY TO BE A DIRECT CAUSE OF THE PATIENT'S DISORDER? IF NECESSARY, ASK ADDITIONAL OPEN-ENDED QUESTIONS.
W2 SUMMARY: HAS AN ''ORGANIC'' / MEDICAL / DRUG RELATED CAUSE BEEN RULED OUT? IF W2 IS YES, THEN W2 SUMMARY IS NO. IF W2 IS NO, THEN W2 SUMMARY IS YES. OTHERWISE IT IS UNCERTAIN.
COLLECT INFORMATION ON ANY DRUGS, major changes to medication, medical illness, and any recent diagnosis of medical illness but can complete W2 summary with support if needed

[During most symptomatic episode] Did these sad, depressed feelings cause a lot of problems at home? At school? With friends? With other people? Or in some other important way?

AND IS HYPOMANIC EPISODE CODED NO (CURRENT AND PAST)? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES? SPECIFY IF THE DEPRESSIVE EPISODE IS CURRENT

Major depressive disorder past - IS MAJOR DEPRESSIVE EPISODE CODED YES (CURRENT, OR PAST, OR RECURRENT)? AND IS MANIC EPISODE CODED NO (CURRENT AND PAST)? AND IS HYPOMANIC EPISODE CODED NO (CURRENT AND PAST)? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES? SPECIFY IF THE DEPRESSIVE EPISODE IS PAST

Major depressive disorder recurrent - IS MAJOR DEPRESSIVE EPISODE CODED YES (CURRENT, OR PAST, OR RECURRENT)? AND IS MANIC EPISODE CODED NO (CURRENT AND PAST)? AND IS HYPOMANIC EPISODE CODED NO (CURRENT AND PAST)? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES? SPECIFY IF THE DEPRESSIVE EPISODE IS RECURRENT: MAJOR DEPRESSIVE DISORDER (MDD) IN THIS MOOD DISORDER ALGORITHM IS CODED YES AND IF, IN MODULE A, EITHER (MD EPISODE CURRENT and MD EPISODE PAST and A5 ARE ALL CODED YES OR MD EPISODE PAST AND A5 ARE BOTH CODED YES)
Bipolar 1 disorder - IS MANIC EPISODE CODED YES (CURRENT OR PAST)? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES?
Bipolar 1 disorder current - IS MANIC EPISODE CODED YES (CURRENT OR PAST)? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES? SPECIFY IF THE BIPOLAR I DISORDER IS CURRENT
Bipolar 1 disorder past - IS MANIC EPISODE CODED YES (CURRENT OR PAST)? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES? SPECIFY IF THE BIPOLAR I DISORDER IS PAST

Single manic episode current - IS MANIC EPISODE CODED YES (CURRENT OR PAST)? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES? SPECIFY WITH SINGLE MANIC EPISODE: IF MANIC EPISODE (CURRENT OR PAST) = YES AND MAJOR DEPRESSIVE EPISODE (CURRENT AND PAST) = NO

Single manic episode past - IS MANIC EPISODE CODED YES (CURRENT OR PAST)? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES? SPECIFY WITH SINGLE MANIC EPISODE: IF MANIC EPISODE (CURRENT OR PAST) = YES AND MAJOR DEPRESSIVE EPISODE (CURRENT AND PAST) = NO

Bipolar 1 disorder recent manic - IS MANIC EPISODE CODED YES (CURRENT OR PAST)? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES? SPECIFY IF THE MOST RECENT EPISODE IS MANIC (MUTUALLY EXCLUSIVE)

Bipolar 1 disorder recent depressed - IS MANIC EPISODE CODED YES (CURRENT OR PAST)? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES? SPECIFY IF THE MOST RECENT EPISODE IS DEPRESSED (MUTUALLY EXCLUSIVE)
In between his/her times of depression, was (s)he free of depression or sadness for of at least 2 months?

Bipolar 1 disorder recent hypomanic - IS MANIC EPISODE CODED YES (CURRENT OR PAST)? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES? SPECIFY IF THE MOST RECENT EPISODE IS HYPOMANIC (MUTUALLY EXCLUSIVE)

Bipolar 1 disorder recent mild - IS MANIC EPISODE CODED YES (CURRENT OR PAST)? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES? SPECIFY IF THE MOST RECENT EPISODE IS MANIC, DEPRESSED, OR HYPOMANIC (MUTUALLY EXCLUSIVE).

Bipolar 1 disorder recent moderate - IS MANIC EPISODE CODED YES (CURRENT OR PAST)? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES? SPECIFY IF THE MOST RECENT EPISODE IS MANIC, DEPRESSED, OR HYPOMANIC (MUTUALLY EXCLUSIVE).

Bipolar 1 disorder recent severe - IS MANIC EPISODE CODED YES (CURRENT OR PAST)? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES? SPECIFY IF THE MOST RECENT EPISODE IS MANIC, DEPRESSED, OR HYPOMANIC (MUTUALLY EXCLUSIVE).

Bipolar 2 disorder - IS MAJOR DEPRESSIVE EPISODE CODED YES (CURRENT OR PAST)? AND IS HYPOMANIC EPISODE CODED YES (CURRENT OR PAST)? AND IS MANIC EPISODE CODED NO (CURRENT AND PAST)? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES?

Bipolar 2 disorder current - IS MAJOR DEPRESSIVE EPISODE CODED YES (CURRENT OR PAST)? AND IS HYPOMANIC EPISODE CODED YES (CURRENT OR PAST)? AND IS MANIC EPISODE CODED NO (CURRENT AND PAST)? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES? SPECIFY IF THE BIPOLAR DISORDER IS CURRENT

Bipolar 2 disorder past - IS MAJOR DEPRESSIVE EPISODE CODED YES (CURRENT OR PAST)? AND IS HYPOMANIC EPISODE CODED YES (CURRENT OR PAST)? AND IS MANIC EPISODE CODED NO (CURRENT AND PAST)? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES? SPECIFY IF THE BIPOLAR DISORDER IS PAST

Bipolar 2 disorder recent hypomanic - IS MAJOR DEPRESSIVE EPISODE CODED YES (CURRENT OR PAST)? AND IS HYPOMANIC EPISODE CODED YES (CURRENT OR PAST)? AND IS MANIC EPISODE CODED NO (CURRENT AND PAST)? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES? SPECIFY IF THE MOST RECENT MOOD EPISODE IS HYPOMANIC (MUTUALLY EXCLUSIVE)

Bipolar 2 disorder recent depressed - IS MAJOR DEPRESSIVE EPISODE CODED YES (CURRENT OR PAST)? AND IS HYPOMANIC EPISODE CODED YES (CURRENT OR PAST)? AND IS MANIC EPISODE CODED NO (CURRENT AND PAST)? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES? SPECIFY IF THE MOST RECENT MOOD EPISODE IS DEPRESSED (MUTUALLY EXCLUSIVE)

Bipolar 2 disorder recent mild - IS MAJOR DEPRESSIVE EPISODE CODED YES (CURRENT OR PAST)? AND IS HYPOMANIC EPISODE CODED YES (CURRENT OR PAST)? AND IS MANIC EPISODE CODED NO (CURRENT AND PAST)? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES? SPECIFY IF THE MOST RECENT MOOD EPISODE IS HYPOMANIC OR DEPRESSED (MUTUALLY EXCLUSIVE).
Major depressive episode - ARE 5 OR MORE ANSWERS (A1-A3) CODED YES AND IS A4 CODED YES FOR THAT TIME FRAME? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES?

Bipolar 2 disorder recent moderate - IS MAJOR DEPRESSIVE EPISODE CODED YES (CURRENT OR PAST)? AND IS HYPOMANIC EPISODE CODED YES (CURRENT OR PAST)? AND IS MANIC EPISODE CODED NO (CURRENT AND PAST)? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES? SPECIFY IF THE MOST RECENT MOOD EPISODE IS HYPOMANIC OR DEPRESSED (MUTUALLY EXCLUSIVE).

Bipolar 2 disorder recent severe - IS MAJOR DEPRESSIVE EPISODE CODED YES (CURRENT OR PAST)? AND IS HYPOMANIC EPISODE CODED YES (CURRENT OR PAST)? AND IS MANIC EPISODE CODED NO (CURRENT AND PAST)? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES? SPECIFY IF THE MOST RECENT MOOD EPISODE IS HYPOMANIC OR DEPRESSED (MUTUALLY EXCLUSIVE).

Other specified bipolar and related disorder - (IS MAJOR DEPRESSIVE EPISODE CODED NO (CURRENT AND PAST)? AND IS MANIC EPISODE CODED NO (CURRENT AND PAST)? AND IS C4b CODED YES FOR THE APPROPRIATE TIME FRAME? AND IS C8b CODED YES?) OR (IS MANIC EPISODE CODED NO (CURRENT AND PAST)? AND IS HYPOMANIC EPISODE CODED NO (CURRENT AND PAST)? AND IS C4a CODED YES FOR THE APPROPRIATE TIME FRAME? AND IS C8c CODED YES?)

Other specified bipolar and related disorder current - (IS MAJOR DEPRESSIVE EPISODE CODED NO (CURRENT AND PAST)? AND IS MANIC EPISODE CODED NO (CURRENT AND PAST)? AND IS C4b CODED YES FOR THE APPROPRIATE TIME FRAME? AND IS C8b CODED YES?) OR (IS MANIC EPISODE CODED NO (CURRENT AND PAST)? AND IS HYPOMANIC EPISODE CODED NO (CURRENT AND PAST)? AND IS C4a CODED YES FOR THE APPROPRIATE TIME FRAME? AND IS C8c CODED YES?) SPECIFY IF THE OTHER SPECIFIED BIPOLAR AND RELATED DISORDER IS CURRENT

Other specified bipolar and related disorder past - (IS MAJOR DEPRESSIVE EPISODE CODED NO (CURRENT AND PAST)? AND IS MANIC EPISODE CODED NO (CURRENT AND PAST)? AND IS C4b CODED YES FOR THE APPROPRIATE TIME FRAME? AND IS C8b CODED YES?) OR (IS MANIC EPISODE CODED NO (CURRENT AND PAST)? AND IS HYPOMANIC EPISODE CODED NO (CURRENT AND PAST)? AND IS C4a CODED YES FOR THE APPROPRIATE TIME FRAME? AND IS C8c CODED YES?) SPECIFY IF THE OTHER SPECIFIED BIPOLAR AND RELATED DISORDER IS PAST

Major depressive episode current - ARE 5 OR MORE ANSWERS (A1-A3) CODED YES AND IS A4 CODED YES FOR THAT TIME FRAME? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES? SPECIFY IF THE EPISODE IS CURRENT

Major depressive episode past - ARE 5 OR MORE ANSWERS (A1-A3) CODED YES AND IS A4 CODED YES FOR THAT TIME FRAME? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES? SPECIFY IF THE EPISODE IS PAST.

Major depressive episode recurrent - ARE 5 OR MORE ANSWERS (A1-A3) CODED YES AND IS A4 CODED YES FOR THAT TIME FRAME? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES? IF A5 IS CODED YES, CODE YES FOR RECURRENT.
IF MORE THAN ONE EPISODE OF DEPRESSION: How many episodes of depression did (s)he have in his/her lifetime? Between each episode there must be at least 2 months without any significant depression.

Do (s)he have anyone in his/her family who had manic-depressive illness or bipolar disorder or a family member who had mood swings treated with a medication like lithium, sodium valproate (Depakote or Valproate), lamotrigine (Lamictal)? THIS QUESTION IS NOT A CRITERION FOR BIPOLAR DISORDER, BUT IS ASKED TO INCREASE THE CLINICIAN''S VIGILANCE ABOUT RISK FOR BIPOLAR DISORDER.
IF YES, PLEASE SPECIFY WHO in his/her family who had manic-depressive illness or bipolar disorder or a family member who had mood swings treated with a medication

Has there ever been a time when (s)he was so happy that (s)he felt ''up'' or ''high'' or ''hyper'' and full of energy? By ''up'' or ''high'' or ''hyper'' I mean feeling really good/having elated mood; full of energy/increased energy or increased activity; needing less sleep; his/her thoughts going very fast or being full of ideas; having an increase in productivity, motivatoin, creativity, or impulse behavior; phoning or working excessively or spending more money. Did (s)he feel very active or full of energy? DO NOT CONSIDER TIMES WHEN THE PATIENT WAS INTOXICATED ON DRUGS OR ALCOHOL OR DURING SITUATIONS THAT NORMALLY OVER STIMULATE AND MAKE CHILDREN VERY EXCITED LIKE CHRISTMAS, BIRTHDAYS, ETC. IF NO TO ALL, CODE NO TO C1b. IF YES TO ANY, ASK:
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes (CODE YES ONLY IF BOTH QUESTIONS ARE ANSWERED YES)

ElementDescription: Is (s)he currently feeling full of energy or ''up'' or ''high'' or ''hyper'' and more active than usual?

Has there ever been a time when (s)he was so grouchy or annoyed for several days, that (s)he yelled or started fights with people outside his/her family? Has (s)he or others noticed that (s)he has been more grouchy than other kids, even when (s)he thought (s)he was right to act this way? DO NOT CONSIDER TIMES WHEN THE PATIENT WAS INTOXICATED ON DRUGS OR ALCOHOL. IF NO TO ALL, CODE NO TO C2b. IF YES TO ANY, ASK:
Is (s)he currently feeling grouchy or annoyed most of the time?
Form used/assessment name
IS C1a OR C2a CODED YES?
How many episodes (most symptomatic past manic/hypomanic episode) has your child had like this in the past? Which one was the most severe or problematic? Let''s focus on that episode.

Over the past few days including today, when (s)he felt high and full of energy or irritable, did (s)he: Feel that (s)he could do things others could not do? Feel that (s)he are a very important person? IF YES, ASK FOR EXAMPLES.
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes (If yes to either, code yes)

ElementDescription: Over the past few days including today, when (s)he felt high and full of energy or irritable, did (s)he: Need less sleep (Did (s)he feel rested after only a few hours of sleep)?

Over the past few days including today, when (s)he felt high and full of energy or irritable, did (s)he: Talk too much without stopping? Talk so fast that people couldn''t understand or follow what (s)he were saying? Did (s)he feel a pressure to keep talking?

Over the past few days including today, when (s)he felt high and full of energy or irritable, did (s)he: Notice his/her thoughts going very fast or running together or racing or moving very quickly from one subject to another?
Over the past few days including today, when (s)he felt high and full of energy or irritable, did (s)he: Get distracted very easily by little things?

Over the past few days including today, when (s)he felt high and full of energy or irritable, did (s)he: Get much more involved in things at school, at home or socially than others, or did (s)he feel much more fidgety or restless? THIS INCREASE IN ACTIVITY MAY BE WITH OR WITHOUT A PURPOSE.

Over the past few days including today, when (s)he felt high and full of energy or irritable, did (s)he: Want to do fun things even if (s)he could get hurt doing them? Want to do things even though it could get (s)he into trouble? (Like staying out late, skipping school, driving dangerously or spending too much money)?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes (If yes to any, code yes)

ElementDescription: WHEN RATING CURRENT EPISODE: IF C1b IS NO, ARE 4 OR MORE C3 ANSWERS INCLUDING C3f CODED YES? IF C1b IS YES, ARE 3 OR MORE C3 ANSWERS INCLUDING C3f CODED YES?
Describe other sex assigned at birth
Past 2 weeks - what is the longest time these symptoms lasted? 3 consecutive days or less. ASSESS THIS DURATION FROM THE VERY START TO THE VERY END OF SYMPTOMS, NOT JUST THE PEAK
Past 2 weeks - what is the longest time these symptoms lasted? 4, 5, or 6 consecutive days or more. ASSESS THIS DURATION FROM THE VERY START TO THE VERY END OF SYMPTOMS, NOT JUST THE PEAK
Past 2 weeks - what is the longest time these symptoms lasted? 7 consecutive days or more. ASSESS THIS DURATION FROM THE VERY START TO THE VERY END OF SYMPTOMS, NOT JUST THE PEAK

Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes (If yes to any, code yes)

Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes (If yes to either, code yes)

ElementDescription: Over a period of a few days in the past, when (s)he felt most high and most full of energy or most irritable, did (s)he: Need less sleep (Did (s)he feel rested after only a few hours of sleep)?

Over a period of a few days in the past, when (s)he felt most high and most full of energy or most irritable, did (s)he: Notice his/her thoughts going very fast or running together or racing or moving very quickly from one subject to another? More than usual?

At any time in his/her life, did (s)he feel sad or depressed? Did (s)he feel down or empty or hopeless? Did (s)he feel grouchy or annoyed? Did (s)he feel this way most of the time, for at least 2 weeks? IF YES TO ANY, CONTINUE. IF NO TO ALL, CODE NO TO A1a AND A1b.
Over a period of a few days in the past, when (s)he felt most high and most full of energy or most irritable, did (s)he: Get distracted very easily by little things? More than usual?

Over a period of a few days in the past, when (s)he felt most high and most full of energy or most irritable, did (s)he: Get much more involved in things at school, at home or socially than others, or did (s)he feel much more fidgety or restless? THIS INCREASE IN ACTIVITY MAY BE WITH OR WITHOUT A PURPOSE. More than usual?

Want to do things even though it could get (s)he into trouble? (Like staying out late, skipping school, driving dangerously or spending too much money)?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes (If yes to any, code yes)

ElementDescription: WHEN RATING PAST EPISODE: IF C1a IS NO, ARE 4 OR MORE C3 ANSWERS INCLUDING C3f CODED YES? IF C1a IS YES, ARE 3 OR MORE C3 ANSWERS INCLUDING C3f CODED YES?
Most severe past - What is the longest time these symptoms lasted? 3 consecutive days or less. ASSESS THIS DURATION FROM THE VERY START TO THE VERY END OF SYMPTOMS, NOT JUST THE PEAK
Most severe past - What is the longest time these symptoms lasted? 4, 5, or 6 consecutive days or more. ASSESS THIS DURATION FROM THE VERY START TO THE VERY END OF SYMPTOMS, NOT JUST THE PEAK
Most severe past - What is the longest time these symptoms lasted? 7 consecutive days or more. ASSESS THIS DURATION FROM THE VERY START TO THE VERY END OF SYMPTOMS, NOT JUST THE PEAK
Most severe past - Was (s)he put in the hospital for these problems? IF YES, CIRCLE YES IN MANIC EPISODE FOR THAT TIME FRAME AND GO TO C7.

Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes (If yes to any, code yes)

Did (s)he feel this way most of the time, for at least 2 weeks? IF YES TO ANY, CONTINUE. IF NO TO ALL, CODE NO TO A2a AND A2b.
Manic Episode - ARE C3 SUMMARY AND C7 AND (C4C OR C5 OR C6) CODED YES? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES?
Manic Episode Current - ARE C3 SUMMARY AND C7 AND (C4C OR C5 OR C6) CODED YES? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES? SPECIFY IF THE MANIC EPISODE IS CURRENT.
Manic Episode Past - ARE C3 SUMMARY AND C7 AND (C4C OR C5 OR C6) CODED YES? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES? SPECIFY IF THE MANIC EPISODE IS PAST.

Hypomanic Episode Current - IS C3 SUMMARY CODED YES AND ARE C5 AND C6 CODED NO AND C7 CODED YES, AND IS EITHER C4b OR C4C CODED YES? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES? SPECIFY IF THE EPISODE IS CURRENT. IF YES TO CURRENT MANIC EPISODE, THEN CODE CURRENT HYPOMANIC EPISODE AS NO.

Hypomanic Episode Past - IS C3 SUMMARY CODED YES AND ARE C5 AND C6 CODED NO AND C7 CODED YES, AND IS EITHER C4b OR C4C CODED YES? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES? SPECIFY IF THE EPISODE IS PAST. IF YES TO PAST MANIC EPISODE, THEN CODE PAST HYPOMANIC EPISODE AS NOT EXPLORED.

Hypomanic Symptoms Current - ARE C3 SUMMARY AND C4a CODED YES AND IS C5 CODED NO? SPECIFY IF THE EPISODE IS CURRENT. IF YES TO CURRENT MANIC EPISODE OR HYPOMANIC EPISODE, THEN CODE CURRENT HYPOMANIC SYMPTOMS AS NO.

Hypomanic Symptoms Past - ARE C3 SUMMARY AND C4a CODED YES AND IS C5 CODED NO? SPECIFY IF THE EPISODE IS PAST. IF YES TO PAST MANIC EPISODE OR YES TO PAST HYPOMANIC EPISODE, THEN CODE PAST HYPOMANIC SYMPTOMS AS NOT EXPLORED.

IF MANIC EPISODE IS POSITIVE FOR EITHER CURRENT OR PAST ASK: Did (s)he have 2 or more of these (manic) episodes lasting 7 days or more (C4c) in his/her lifetime (including the current episode if present)?

IF MANIC OR HYPOMANIC EPISODE IS POSITIVE FOR EITHER CURRENT OR PAST ASK: Did (s)he have 2 or more of these (hypomanic) episodes lasting 4 days or more (C4b) in his/her lifetime (including the current episode)?

IF THE PAST ''HYPOMANIC SYMPTOMS'' CATEGORY IS CODED POSITIVE ASK: Did (s)he have (hypomanic) symptoms like these lasting only 1 to 3 days (C4a) 2 or more times in his/her lifetime, (including the current episode, if present)?
IS A1a OR A2a CODED YES?
Did (s)he have these worries for a month or more?
D3 SUMMARY: IF YES TO BOTH D3a AND D3b QUESTIONS, CODE YES.
ARE BOTH D3 SUMMARY, AND 4 OR MORE D4 ANSWERS, CODED YES?
For the past month: Did (s)he worry that it would happen again?
For the past month: Did (s)he worry that something bad would happen because of the attack?
For the past month: Did anything change for him/her because of the attack? NO YES (e.g., going out only with someone, not wanting to leave his/her house, going to the doctor more frequently)?
IF YES TO D6b, or D6c, or D6d, CODE YES.
Panic disorder - IS EITHER D5 OR D6 CODED YES? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES?
Panic disorder lifetime - IS EITHER D5 OR D6 CODED YES? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES? SPECIFY IF THE EPISODE IS CURRENT
Panic disorder current - IS EITHER D5 OR D6 CODED YES? AND IS ''RULE OUT ORGANIC CAUSE (W2 SUMMARY)'' CODED YES? SPECIFY IF THE EPISODE IS LIFETIME.
